page.title: 10Agriculture
page.content: The agriculture carried on in this block is almost entirely arable farming.Barley predominates but wheat also is grown.Sugar beet is also a very important crop and this is harvested and transported to the refinery in nearby Bury St Edmunds in strict rotation.It must be delivered on the day stipulated and if it is not then that particular delivery is missed and must wait,rather than interrupt subsequent deliveries. Of late,oil seed rape is of considerable importance to the cooking oil and "margarine" industry,and the fields are yellow during flowering time.This is often confused with previous yellow fields which were then mustard flower.Apart from these crops,little else was found.
